entry.title: Lock screen disable bug
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Set BIP to disable lock screen when charging 2. Connect charger 3. Remove charger 4. Turn phone off then on What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? Lock screen stays disabled until i manually re-enable it What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? BIP Pro 5.0.4 Which device are you using? HTC Wildfire S Which carrier are you using? Vodafone What language is your device set to? English (UK) Which version of Android are you using? Android 2.3.3 Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? Advanced task killer Please provide any additional information here:

entry.title: Does not work properly on Samsung Galaxy Y CDMA
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Charge the battery till 100 % (off mode) 2. When you turn on the mobile, the indicator directly drop to 98% or 96% 3. The voltage of the battery always shown as 0.003V ps1: the mobile is brand new, bought from authorized Samsung Reseller. What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? 2: Should have shown 100% 3: Should have shown between 3.7 to 4.0 volt What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? Free, 4.0.7 Which device are you using? Samsung Galaxy Y CDMA (Samsung SCH-i509) Which carrier are you using? Telkom Flexi What language is your device set to? English Which version of Android are you using? 2.3.6 Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? Nope Please provide any additional information here: It works perfectly fine on my other Samsung Device (Galaxy S2, GT-I9100) but not the SCH-i509. Great aps though, hopefully there's fix soon
entry.issues:label: Type-Defect

entry.title: Lock Screen Bug under Android 4 with Galaxy Nexus
entry.content:
Steps to reproduce the problem: 1. Android 4 (Galaxy Nexus) 2. Running the app 3. Disable the Lock Screen Funktion in the options
The screen will unlock sporadically. Well not always but often.
Version: Battery Indicator Pro
Device: Galaxa Nexus with Android 4.0.1
Carrier: Vodafone
Language: German
No "Task Killer" installed!

entry.title: Cannot use menu options after latest update
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. 2. 3. [Add or remove numbers as necessary] What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? All menu options should work, but only "Close" functions without any issues. Selecting "Settings" causes a force close, and selecting "Logs" or "Help" opens a new window that constantly causes force closes until I hit home to dismiss the screen, so there is no way I can use these options. Also, when the program window first appears, it is grayed out with the rest of the screen. What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? Pro v5.0.5 Which device are you using? Samsung Behold II Which carrier are you using? T-Mobile What language is your device set to? English Which version of Android are you using? 1.6 Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? No Please provide any additional information here:
entry.issues:label: Type-Defect

entry.title: Excessive battery drain using widget on ICS
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Run a leaked version of ICS with Sense What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? While I realise it is unfair to expect you to support leaked versions of Google Os's, I wanted to report this to highlight a future possible issue when officially Release, when using this widget on ICS my battery drains from full charge to 0 in under 6 hours. Now removed the widget and today over 13 hours and still 65% left. This was on a clean install. What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? Free Which device are you using? HTC Sensation Which carrier are you using? Vodafone UK What language is your device set to? English Which version of Android are you using? ICS leak with Sense Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? No Please provide any additional information here:
entry.issues:label: Type-Defect

entry.title: Phone restarts randomly after enabling logging
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Turn on logging 2. Set to 1 week retention and Log Everything What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? I should get logging and nothing else should happen What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? Pro 5.0.7 Which device are you using? Samsung Galaxy SII Which carrier are you using? Vodafone What language is your device set to? English Which version of Android are you using? 2.3.5 Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? No Please provide any additional information here: I admit that I've not done any extensive testing, but the last change I made was to enable logging in this app. Since then my phone has restarted randomly 3 times in the last 2 days. It's been supposedly idle at the time. I've only had one app update in this time, but that update was for an app with no services.
entry.issues:label: Type-Defect

entry.title: battery pro sticks at 100% after it is unplugged
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Usually happens when my phone is plugged via USB at work (Window 7). 2. This doesn't always happen. 3. The phone charges all night on a charger and it has never been a problem in the morning when I disconnect the charger. What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? Batter Pro reads 100%. After a while, i become suspect of the stellar batter performance. I need to shut phone off and restart it. Battery Pro then shows the correct %. What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? Pro 5.0.2 Which device are you using? Samsun Galaxy SII Which carrier are you using? T-Mobile What language is your device set to? English Which version of Android are you using? 2.3.5 Do you have an "Task Killer" or similar apps installed? yes but I have it set to ignore battery pro Please provide any additional information here: It never had this problem with my Galaxy S (save carrier).

entry.title: My device only shows 10% increments, but some apps show 1% increments, can you add a workaround for my device?
entry.content: Is there any way to get the notification bar to show the power remaining to the nearest percentage, rather than to the nearest 10%? Other programs do this and it would be great if this one did, too.
entry.issues:label: Type-Defect
Priority-High

entry.title: Lockscreen Reenables after Restart
entry.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Disable Lock Screen using BIP 2. Restart phone 3. After phone has fully booted, turn off the screen, then turn it back on. What is the expected outcome? What happens instead? After restarting the phone and turning off then back on the screen, I expect there to be no lock screen since I have disabled it using BIP. However every time after I restart my phone, the lockscreen is on again. I then have to open BIP and press Reenable, then Disable Lock Screen to turn it off. What branch (Free or Pro) and version (number) of the app are you using? Pro 4.0.4 Which device are you using? HTC Evo 4G Which carrier are you using? Sprint Which version of Android are you using? 2.2 Please provide any additional information here: I used to have an app that I believe was called "No Lock" that I used to disable my lockscreen before I found BIP. I uninstalled it after installing BIP. It used to keep the lockscreen off permanently, even after restarting the phone. With BIP though, I have to re-disable it each time. According to BIP, the lockscreen is still disabled, because the option says "Reenable Lockscreen." However, the lockscreen is already on. To disable it again, I have to press Reenable then Disable.
entry.issues:label: Type-Defect
Priority-Medium
